page.title: 08Housing
page.content: With a fast growth in population over the past 15 years, most of the housing is relatively new. Ugglebarnby is a very old village with some new buildings, mostly bungalows. It is linear and surrounded by scattered farms. Sleights originally developed along the old toll road and the present day B1410. Housing then developed on the western slope of Iburndale. Within Sleights, is council housing some of these homes being built after 1945. The other council houses are recent (around 1970). Off the A169 are a number of small private estates built over the last 10 years, even more recently, further housing estates have been developed. There are also a number of council owned OAP bungalows. The rest of the housing in the area are scattered farms and cottages.
